summary: innate immune responses are activated through host pattern recognition receptors. PRRs initiate signaling pathways, ultimately triggering the production of type I interferons (IFNs) the type I IFN signal is then transducted by the activation of Janus kinase (JAK) family protein kinases. IPS-1 complex recruits downstream adaptor proteins tumornecrosis factor receptor-associated factor 2 (TRAF2), TRAF3 and TRAF6, and TANK-binding kinase 1 (TBK1) and I kappaB kinse (IKK). ubiquitination is a highly regulated process that has been found to be involved in a myriad of cellular functions. deubiquitinating enzyme A (DUBA) selectively cleaves polyubiquitin chains on TRAF3. CYLD removes lysine-63-linked polyubiquitin chains from receptor interacting protein (RIP) despite the importance of DUBs, the functions of DUBs during the antiviral innate immune response are largely unknown. pNF-B-Luc and pISRE-Luc were from Stratagene. full-length hemagglutinin (HA)-tagged mutants in which all but one Lys residue (HA-K48-Ub or HA-K63-Ub) was replaced with Arg were gifts from T. Ohta. pCAGGS-HA-USP25 or pCAGGS-Myc-USP25 were amplified by PCR from cDNA of HEK-293T cells. hek-293T cells were co-transfected with 0.1 g of luciferase reporter plasmid (p125-Luc for IFN-, (PRDIII-I)4-Luc for IRF3. pNF-B-Luc for NF-B, and pISRE-Luc for ISRE. luciferase assays were performed using a dual-specific luciferase assay kit. the relative luciferase activity was calculated by dividing the Firefly luciferase activity by the Renilla luciferase activity. ination assay Wild-type HA-tagged USP25 protein was purified from cells transfected with pCAGGS-HA-USP25. a HA tagged Protein PURIFICATION KIT was also used to isolate proteins from empty-vector transfected cells. a control reaction mixture was incubated under identical conditions with the exclusion of the enzyme. pCAGGS-HA or pCAGGS-Myc vector was supplemented to keep the total amount of DNA transfected constant. cells were harvested by adding 200 L 2 lysis buffer A (LBA) (65 mM Tris-HCl (pH 6.8), 4% sodium dodecyl sulfate, 3% DL-dithiothreitol, and 40% glycerol) anti-USP25, anti-IRF3, anti-phosphor-IRF3, anti-NF-B p65, anti-phosphor-NF-B p65 and anti-ubiquitin antibodies were purchased from ABclonal Biotechnology. horsesradish peroxidase-conjugated anti-mouse or anti-rabbit IgG antibodies were obtained from beyotime Institute of Biotechnology (Jiangsu, China) full-length hemagglutinin (HA)-tagged mutants in which all but one Lys residue (HA-K48-Ub or HA-K63-Ub) was replaced with Arg were gifts from T. USP25 negatively regulates IFN- expression by inhibiting SEV-induced activation of IRF3 and NF-B. HEK-293T cells were transfected with either an empty vector (1 g) or increasing amounts of USP25 (0.25, 0.5, or 1 g) or porcine reproductive and respiratory syndrome virus (PRRSV) NSP1. a DNA construct expressing USP25 was transfected into HEK-293T cells. the recombinant USP25 was purified from cell lysates using a HA tagged Protein PURIFICATION KIT (MBL) the protein was obtained from USP25-transfected or mock-transfected HEK-293T cells using a HA tagged protein PURIFICATION KIT (MBL) HEK-293T cells were transfected with either an empty vector or increasing amounts of plasmid DNA encoding USP25. the effect of USP25 on all ubiquitinated cellular proteins was assessed via Western blotting with an anti-Flag antibody. transfection with USP25 resulted in an obvious reduction in the extent of conjugation of K48- and K63-linked polyubiquitin. cell lysates were prepared at 30 h post-transfection and analyzed for Ub-conjugated proteins. western blotting with anti-HA antibodies showed expression of USP25. western blotting for beta-actin served as a protein loading control. blotting for beta-actin served as a protein loading control. identification of USP25 DUB activity sites Based on the structures of their catalytic domains, the human DUBs have been classified into five subfamilies. we chose six USPs whose DUB activity had been reported [34,37–41] the catalytic mutants (C178A and H607A) devoid of DUB activity lost the ability of USP25 WT-mediated IFN inhibition to some degree. the deubiquitinating activity of USP25 is involved in virus-induced type I IFN signaling. HEK-293T cells were transfected with DNA constructs encoding IFN--Luc. overexpression of RIG-I, IPS-1, TRAF2 or TRAF6 significantly activated IFN- promoter compared with cells transfected with an empty vector control. however, such effects were all substantially reduced in presence of USP25. the input tagged proteins were verified with the indicated antibodies. we investigated whether the IFN antagonist function of USP25 is associated with the deubiquitination of RIG-I, IPS-1, TRAF2 and TRAF6, which are essential signaling components in the type I IFN pathway activated by virus infection. inating enzymes encoded in the human genome have received extensive attention. in this study, we identified USP25 as a major deubiquitinase of RIG-I, TRAF2 and TRAF6 in type I IFN induction. it is thought not all USPs that contain well-conserved motifs have DUB activity. USP11 negatively regulates TNF-induced NF-B activation associated with IB and attenuates IB degradation. USP20 deubiquitinates TRAF6 and suppresses interleukin 1 (IL-1)- and tax-induced NF-B activation. ubiquitin ligase TRIM25 is necessary and sufficient to activate IPS-1. cIAP1/2 triggers downstream signaling cascade to produce type I IFN. however, certain cellular USPs are known to modulate the antiviral innate immune response. co-immunoprecipitation investigation showed that USP25 interacted with RIG-I and TRAF6 to reduce type I interferon induction. further investigation will be required to identify mutants that disrupt the interaction of USP25 and RIG-I/TRAF6 but do not affect DUB activity. kines and type I IFNs negatively modulates type I IFN signaling. usP25 acts as a DUB that cleaved ubiquitin chains from RIG-I, TRAF2 and TRAF6. this inhibits type I IFN signaling.
